intro: Cyclopogon lineatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
